intro: Parasponia andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's parasponia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
